intro: Althaea acaulis, commonly known as the slender marshmallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and hairy, lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Althaea acaulis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas.
